file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-51-04-04 - BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT FLOOR LINING - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT FLOOR LINING - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the baggage-compartment floor lining. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR LIN- ALL 25-51-04-000-801-A ING - REMOVAL BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR LIN- ALL 25-51-04-400-801-A ING - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 25-51-04 Page 1 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-51-04-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR LINING - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the baggage-compartment floor lining. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION (TASK 25-50-04-000-801-A) - AMM SDS 52-30-00/1 AMM TASK 25-26-07-000-801-A/400 - BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT ANTI-BLOCKAGE BAR- AMM TASK 25-50-01-000-801-A/400 RIER - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-50-02-000-801-A/400 CARGO NET ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-51-01-000-801-A/400 BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT LINING - REMOVAL S.B.145-25-0100 - TASK 25-50-03-000-801-A - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber gloves Chemical protection AR available Commercially Safety goggles Eye protection AR available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MIL-PRF-680 Solvent AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Rear baggage-compartment EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-51-04 Page 2 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Open the baggage door (AMM SDS 52-30-00/1) to get access to the baggage- compartment. (2) Release the anti-blockage barrier from the floor anchor plate assemblies ( AMM TASK 25-50-01-000-801-A/400). (3) Remove the cargo vertical barrier net ( AMM TASK 25-50-02-000-801-A/400), if applicable. (4) Remove the cargo restraint net ( AMM TASK 25-50-02-000-801-A/400). (5) For aircraft with trolley stowage unit, do these steps: (a) Remove the trolley stowage unit AMM TASK 25-26-07-000-801-A/400 only if you will remove the panels I and/or II. (b) Remove the ramp assembly (TASK 25-50-04-000-801-A) only if you will remove the panel I. (6) Remove the anchor plate assemblies AMM TASK 25-50-02-000-801-A/400, as applicable. (7) Remove the floor angles AMM TASK 25-51-01-000-801-A/400, as applicable. (8) Remove the cargo loading/unloading ramp (TASK 25-50-03-000-801-A). J. Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) (Figure 403) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) On aircraft PRE-MOD S.B.145-25-0100 (Figure 401), do the steps (a) thru (d): (a) Remove the screws (3) and the washers (4) that attach the floor finish fittings (2). (b) Pull the floor lining (1) to remove it from the baggage floor panels. (c) Remove the double-backed tape from the baggage floor panels. WARNING: WHEN YOU DO STEP (d) BELOW, WEAR PROTECTIVE GLOVES AND GOGGLES TO APPLY THE SOLVENT. (d) Remove the double-backed tape residues with the specified solvent. (2) On aircraft POST-MOD S.B.145-25-0100 and with trolley stowage unit (Figure 402) (Figure 403), do the procedure below. Refer to all the panels (I through V) of the floor lining: NOTE: Do step (a) bellow only if you will remove the panels I and/or IV. (a) Remove the screws (7) and washers (8) that attach the floor finish fitting 1 (4) and/or 2 (3), as applicable. (b) Remove the screws (5) and washers (6) that attach the baggage floor panel. (c) Pull the floor lining (2) to remove it from the baggage floor panel. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-51-04 Page 3 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (d) Remove the double-backed tape from the baggage floor panel. WARNING: WHEN YOU DO STEP (e) BELOW, WEAR PROTECTIVE GLOVES AND GOGGLES TO APPLY THE SOLVENT. (e) Remove the double-backed tape residues with the specified solvent. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-51-04 Page 4 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-51-04-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR LINING - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the baggage-compartment floor lining. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION (TASK 25-50-03-400-801-A) - (TASK 25-50-04-400-801-A) - AMM SDS 52-30-00/1 AMM TASK 25-26-07-400-801-A/400 - BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT ANTI-BLOCKAGE BAR- AMM TASK 25-50-01-400-801-A/400 RIER - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 25-50-02-400-801-A/400 CARGO NET ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 25-51-01-400-801-A/400 BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT LINING - INSTALLATION S.B.145-25-0100 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) Commercially available Double-backed tape 666-3M 2.00W AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Baggage-compartment I. Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) (Figure 403) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) On aircraft PRE-MOD S.B.145-25-0100 (Figure 401), do the steps (a) through (e) below: EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-51-04 Page 8 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (a) Put a strip of double-backed tape along the edges of the rear baggage- compartment floor. (b) Put long strips of the double-backed tape over the floor panels of the compartment. (c) Install the floor lining (1) over the double-backed tape and push it down. (d) Trim the lining material around the floor angles. (e) Install the floor finish fittings (2) with the screws (3) and washers (4). (2) On aircraft POST-MOD S.B.145-25-0100 and with trolley stowage unit (Figure 402) (Figure 403), do the steps (a) thru (e): (a) Put a strip of double-backed tape along the edges of the rear baggage- compartment floor. (b) Put long strips of double-backed tape over the floor panels of the compartment. (c) Install the floor lining (2) over the double-backed tape and push it down. (d) If you removed the floor finish fitting 1 (4) and/or 2 (3), install it again with the screws (7) and washers (8). (e) Install the screws (5) and washers (6) that attach the baggage floor panel. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) If you removed the cargo loading/unloading ramp, install it again (TASK 25-50-03-400-801-A). (2) Install the floor angles AMM TASK 25-51-01-400-801-A/400. (3) Install the anchor plate assemblies AMM TASK 25-50-02-400-801-A/400. (4) For aircraft with trolley stowage unit, do the steps below: (a) If you remove the ramp assembly, install it again (TASK 25-50-04-400-801-A). (b) If you removed the trolley stowage unit, install it again AMM TASK 25-26-07-400-801-A/400. (5) Install the cargo restraint net AMM TASK 25-50-02-400-801-A/400. (6) If you removed the cargo vertical barrier net, install it again AMM TASK 25-50-02-400-801-A/400. (7) Fit the anti-blockage barrier to the floor anchor plates assemblies AMM TASK 25-50-01-400-801-A/400. (8) Close the baggage door (AMM SDS 52-30-00/1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-51-04 Page 9 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
